columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the external financing needed to finance the sales growth of the company assuming that the fixed assets are acquired at a new cost.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us determine the EFN using the following given in the income statement of the company:
 
<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$46,298,115|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$34,536,913|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Other Expenses|\$5,870,865|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Depreciation|\$2,074,853|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Earnings Before Interest and Tax|\$3,815,484|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Interest|\$725,098|
|$\hspace{40pt}$Taxable Income|\$3,090,386|
|$\hspace{40pt}$Taxes (21\%)|\$772,597|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$2,317,789|
|Dividends|\$705,000|
|Addition to Retained Earnings|\$1,612,789|

Now, let us compute the projected Earnings before Interest and Taxes:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Earnings before Interest and Taxes}&=\text{Projected Sales}\\[5pt]
&-\text{Projected Cost}\\[5pt]
&-\text{Projected Other Expenses}\\[5pt]
&-\text{Projected Depreciation}\\[12pt]
&={\$51,853,888.80}-{\$38,890,416.60}\\[5pt]
&-{\$6,222,466.66}-{\$2,074,155.55}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$4,666,849.99}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected Earnings before Interest and Taxes is \$4,666,849.99.**

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$51,853,888.80}\\
\text{Cost}&{38,890,416.60}\\
\text{Other Expenses}&{6,222,466.66}\\
\text{Depreciation}&\underline{2,074,155.55}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Earnings Before Interest and Taxes}&{\$4,666,849.99}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Interest Paid}&\underline{725,098}\\
\hspace{20pt}\text{Taxable Income}&{\$3,941,751.99}\\
\hspace{20pt}\text{Taxes}&\underline{827,767.92}\\
\hspace{30pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{3,113,984.07}}}\\
\end{array}$$

## Percentage of Sales Approach
\
The percentage of sales approach is a financial planning model in which the concept is to separate the accounts in the income statement and in the balance sheet into two sections- one which is directly affected by sales and the other which does not.
\
Through the sales forecast, the amount of the necessary funding is determined that will support the estimated sales of the company.

Now, let us determine the EFN using the following given for the balance sheet of the company:
 
<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Assets||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cash|\$524,963|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Accounts Receivable|\$843,094|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Inventory|\$1,235,161|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Plant and Equipment|\$20,381,945|
|Total Assets|\$22,285,163|
|Liabilities and Owners' Equity||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Accounts Payable|\$1,068,356|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Notes Payable|\$2,439,553|
|Total Current Liabilities|\$3,507,909|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Long-term Debt|\$6,300,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Common Stock|\$460,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Retained Earnings|\$12,717,254|
|Total Equity|\$13,177,254|
|Total Debt and Equity|\$22,985,163|

Now, let us compute the total debt and equity:
 
$$\begin{aligned} \text{Total Debt and Equity}&=\text{Total Debt and Equity}+\text{Additional Retained Earnings}\\[12pt]
&={\$31,698,285.16 }+{\$2,179,788.85}\\[12pt] 
&=\boxed{\$25,164,951.85}\\ \end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected total debt and equity amounts to $25,164,951.85.**

To balance the total debt and equity and the total assets, we are to compute the external financing needed by the company:
  
$$\begin{aligned} \text{EFN}&=\text{Total Assets}-\text{Total Debt and Equity}\\[12pt] 
&={\$31,698,285.16 }-{\$25,164,951.85}\\[12pt] 
&=\boxed{\$6,533,333.31 }\\ \end{aligned}$$

**The external financing needed amounts to $6,533,333.31 .**

The table in the succeeding step indicates a change in the accounts in the balance sheet. This amount is derived by deducting the current amounts in the balance sheet from the projected amounts to determine the difference/ changes in the said amounts.
**With the additional \$5,000,000 in fixed assets, the capacity utilization of the company for the next year is 90\%.**
